edu.rit.util

Class Plural

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.Plural

  • public class Plural
extends Object
    Class Plural provides an object for printing a number followed by a word with the proper pluralization.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Plural(int number, String word)
      Construct a new plural object.
      Plural(int number, String singularWord, String pluralWord)
      Construct a new plural object.
      Plural(long number, String word)
      Construct a new plural object.
      Plural(long number, String singularWord, String pluralWord)
      Construct a new plural object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String toString()
      Returns a string version of this plural object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Plural

        public Plural(int number,
      String word)
        Construct a new plural object. If the number is 1, the string version is "<number> <word>". Otherwise, the string version is "<number> <word>s".
        Parameters:
        number - Number to print.
        word - Word to print.

      • Plural

        public Plural(long number,
      String word)
        Construct a new plural object. If the number is 1, the string version is "<number> <word>". Otherwise, the string version is "<number> <word>s".
        Parameters:
        number - Number to print.
        word - Word to print.

      • Plural

        public Plural(int number,
      String singularWord,
      String pluralWord)
        Construct a new plural object. If the number is 1, the string version is "<number> <singularWord>". Otherwise, the string version is "<number> <pluralWord>".
        Parameters:
        number - Number to print.
        singularWord - Singular word to print.
        pluralWord - Plural word to print.

      • Plural

        public Plural(long number,
      String singularWord,
      String pluralWord)
        Construct a new plural object. If the number is 1, the string version is "<number> <singularWord>". Otherwise, the string version is "<number> <pluralWord>".
        Parameters:
        number - Number to print.
        singularWord - Singular word to print.
        pluralWord - Plural word to print.
